1.description: A fierce blue SeaWing princess who has just returned to her mother's kingdom after years of captivity. Struggles to adapt to royal life while maintaining her bonds with her fellow dragonets.
1.role: SeaWing Princess and Dragonet of Destiny

15.description: Learns to use Aquatic, the underwater light language of SeaWings, allowing her to communicate properly with her mother and other SeaWings for the first time.

1.description: The kind-hearted brown MudWing continues his journey with the dragonets of destiny. His fireproof scales proved crucial in their escape from Queen Scarlet.

relationships.Peril: Dangerous friend from the SkyWing arena

1.description: The sarcastic RainWing with deadly venom continues her journey with the dragonets. Her quick thinking and lethal abilities helped them escape Queen Scarlet's palace.

relationships.Jambu: RainWing who might be her brother

1.description: The anxious black NightWing scholar continues to provide knowledge and worry in equal measure. Still struggles with his lack of traditional NightWing powers.

relationships.Tsunami: Fellow dragonet he cares for deeply

1.description: The small, optimistic yellow SandWing continues to be the heart of the group. Her unusual appearance and missing tail barb remain mysterious.

2.description: The ruling SeaWing queen and Tsunami's mother. Devastated by the loss of her daughter years ago and overjoyed but overprotective upon her return.

8.description: Reveals she's been writing scrolls about her daughters and the royal family. Extremely protective of her remaining children after losing so many eggs to a mysterious killer.

3.description: Tsunami's younger sister and the heir to the SeaWing throne. A bright green SeaWing princess who has lived her entire life in the Deep Palace.

relationships.Tsunami: Older sister she's eager to know

16.description: Revealed to be an animus dragon with powerful magic abilities. This makes her incredibly valuable and dangerous, explaining Queen Coral's extreme protectiveness.

relationships.Whirlpool: Tutor who wants to control her power
relationships.Tsunami: Sister who wants to protect her from magic's corruption

3.description: The youngest SeaWing princess, still a baby. Queen Coral's latest daughter and the apple of her eye, kept under constant guard.

4.description: The SeaWing king and Queen Coral's husband. A steady presence in the royal family, though often overshadowed by his queen's strong personality.

relationships.Tsunami: Daughter he's glad to have home

1.description: A young blue SeaWing who was part of the Talons of Peace. Now serves as a guard in Queen Coral's palace and shows interest in Princess Tsunami.
1.role: Palace Guard and Former Talons Member

12.description: Reveals more about his past with the Talons of Peace and his genuine feelings for Tsunami, despite their class differences as princess and guard.

5.description: A pompous green SeaWing who serves as royal tutor to the princesses. Overly flattering to Queen Coral and shows inappropriate interest in young Princess Anemone.

relationships.Anemone: Student he shows too much interest in

16.description: His true motives are revealed as he attempts to control Anemone's animus magic for his own gain, showing his manipulative and dangerous nature.

relationships.Anemone: Animus dragon he wants to control

4.description: A large grey SeaWing who serves as one of Queen Coral's palace guards. Strong and loyal but not particularly bright.

6.description: An elderly SeaWing who serves on Queen Coral's royal council. Wise but sometimes questions the queen's decisions regarding the war.

7.description: A light blue SeaWing noble who frequents Queen Coral's court. Gossipy and interested in royal family drama.

9.description: A young SeaWing dragonet who lives in the Deep Palace. Curious about the returned princess and the dragonets of destiny.

8.description: The most intelligent and manipulative of the three SandWing sisters fighting for the throne. Currently allied with Queen Coral and the SeaWings.

22.description: Reveals her true ruthless nature and willingness to eliminate anyone who threatens her path to the throne, including the dragonets if necessary.

relationships.Anemone: Animus dragon she wants to control

1.description: The former guardian of the dragonets, now revealed as Tsunami's egg-thief. Struggles with guilt over his past actions while trying to help the dragonets.
A SeaWing leader of the Talons of Peace organization. Coordinates peace efforts and helps guide the dragonets' mission.

relationships.Tsunami: Princess he hopes will bring peace

11.description: One of Queen Coral's sons and Tsunami's brother. A quiet, bookish SeaWing prince who prefers to stay out of the spotlight.

13.description: A deceased SeaWing princess, Queen Coral's daughter who died years ago. Her death was part of the pattern of mysterious royal egg and dragonet killings.

20.description: Revealed to have been an animus dragon who created a statue that kills royal SeaWing heirs, explaining the mysterious deaths in the royal family.

relationships.Auklet: Sister nearly killed by her creation

7.description: A SeaWing servant who works in Queen Coral's Deep Palace. Helps maintain the royal chambers and serves the royal family.

8.description: A military SeaWing general who serves Queen Coral in the war against the SandWings. Strategic and loyal to the crown.

9.description: A SeaWing soldier serving in Queen Coral's military forces. Participates in patrols and palace security duties.

11.description: A SeaWing who frequents Queen Coral's court. Often seen discussing politics and royal family matters with other nobles.

4.description: A SeaWing guard who protects the Deep Palace and royal family. Works alongside Shark and other guards in palace security.

6.description: A fast SeaWing who serves as a royal messenger, carrying communications between Queen Coral and her allies.

7.description: A SeaWing servant working in the Deep Palace, responsible for maintaining the royal quarters and assisting with daily needs.

18.description: The imposing NightWing who created the dragonet prophecy appears to check on their progress and judge their worthiness for their destiny.

13.description: The largest and most military-minded of the three SandWing sisters. Enemy of Queen Coral and her allies, known for her collection of rare creatures.
The most beautiful but least intelligent of the three SandWing sisters competing for the throne. Currently hiding with the IceWings.

1.description: The dangerous SkyWing with firescales who became Clay's friend. Still searching for her place in the world after leaving Queen Scarlet.

3.description: A blue-green SeaWing guard who serves Queen Coral loyally at the Deep Palace. One of many guards protecting the royal family.

4.description: A SeaWing palace guard who helps maintain security at the Deep Palace. Part of Queen Coral's extensive security force.
A loyal SeaWing guard assigned to protect the royal family. Takes his duties very seriously and follows all protocol.

6.description: A SeaWing council member who advises Queen Coral on matters of state. Experienced in palace politics and tribal affairs.
An older SeaWing council member with decades of experience. One of Queen Coral's most trusted advisors.

4.description: A SeaWing who works in the palace kitchens, preparing meals for the royal family and their guests.
A SeaWing servant who maintains the palace and tends to the needs of the royal family and their guests.
A SeaWing who helps maintain the Deep Palace, keeping the underwater structure in perfect condition.

5.description: A gentle SeaWing who helps care for the royal dragonets in the palace nursery. Patient and protective of young dragons.

8.description: A scholarly SeaWing who teaches the royal dragonets about SeaWing history, Aquatic language, and palace protocol.

11.description: A SeaWing healer who tends to injuries and illnesses in the palace. Has extensive knowledge of underwater medicine.

6.description: A fast-swimming SeaWing who carries messages for Queen Coral throughout the kingdom and to allied tribes.

7.description: A SeaWing captain who commands the palace guards. Experienced military leader responsible for royal family security.

5.description: A SeaWing who designed and maintains the underwater architecture of the Deep Palace. Expert in underwater construction.

6.description: A SeaWing who makes official announcements for the royal court. Has a strong voice that carries well underwater.

8.description: A scholarly SeaWing who keeps records of SeaWing history and genealogy. Particularly knowledgeable about the royal bloodline.

5.description: A SeaWing who tends to the underwater gardens around the Deep Palace, maintaining the beautiful sea plants and corals.

12.description: A fast SeaWing messenger who carries urgent communications for Queen Coral, especially during times of crisis.
A secretive SeaWing who gathers intelligence for Queen Coral about threats to the kingdom and royal family.

7.description: A highly trained SeaWing guard who protects the most important members of the royal family. Elite warrior with years of experience.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen he protects with his life

6.description: A SeaWing who assists Queen Coral with daily administrative duties and royal correspondence. Highly trusted by the queen.

12.description: A SeaWing scout who patrols the waters around the Deep Palace, watching for threats and reporting suspicious activity.

4.description: A SeaWing chef who prepares special meals for the royal family. Expert at preparing both sea creatures and land food for guests.

8.description: An elderly SeaWing who has served the royal family for decades. Repository of palace traditions and royal protocol.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen he has served for years

9.description: A SeaWing warrior who trains the palace guards in combat and maintains the royal armory. Expert in underwater warfare.

4.description: A humble SeaWing who keeps the Deep Palace clean and well-maintained. Works quietly to ensure royal comfort.
A sturdy SeaWing who carries supplies and messages throughout the palace. Reliable and hardworking staff member.

11.description: A SeaWing guard who works the night shift, protecting the palace while the royal family sleeps. Vigilant and alert.

9.description: A SeaWing responsible for maintaining the palace armory and weapon supplies. Ensures all guards have proper equipment.

5.description: A skilled SeaWing who creates and maintains royal garments and ceremonial items. Expert in underwater textiles.
A SeaWing artisan who creates jewelry and decorative items for the royal family. Skilled in working with pearls and precious stones.

2.description: A SeaWing warrior who patrols the borders of the Sea Kingdom, watching for enemies and protecting territorial waters.

7.description: A young SeaWing guard newly assigned to palace duty. Eager to prove himself and protect the royal family.

8.description: A SeaWing who manages the royal treasury and keeps track of the kingdom's wealth and resources.

18.description: An experienced SeaWing military advisor who counsels Queen Coral on war strategy and alliance matters.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen he advises on military matters

6.description: A meticulous SeaWing who keeps detailed records of palace activities, royal decrees, and important events.

10.description: A SeaWing guard stationed at the Summer Palace. Protects the royal family during their visits to the surface palace.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen he protects at Summer Palace

5.description: A cheerful SeaWing who provides entertainment for the royal court with stories, songs, and performances.

12.description: A secretive SeaWing who gathers information about potential threats to the kingdom and royal family.

6.description: A SeaWing who announces important visitors and royal proclamations throughout the palace and kingdom.

5.description: A gentle SeaWing who provides relaxation services to the royal family, helping them manage the stress of ruling.
A clever SeaWing who maintains and improves the mechanical systems of the Deep Palace, including lighting and water flow.

11.description: A knowledgeable SeaWing who tends to the palace herb gardens and provides medicinal plants to the healer.

5.description: A cultured SeaWing who curates and maintains the royal art collection, including the statue of Princess Orca.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen whose art collection she manages
relationships.Princess Orca: Deceased princess whose statue she tends

5.description: A SeaWing who arranges beautiful underwater flowers and decorations for royal ceremonies and special occasions.

relationships.Sea Anemone: Garden keeper she gets flowers from

3.description: A steady SeaWing guard who patrols the Deep Palace entrances. Reliable and watchful protector of the royal family.

4.description: A blue SeaWing guard assigned to protect Princess Anemone. Takes his duty of protecting the animus princess very seriously.

5.description: A powerful SeaWing guard with years of experience protecting the royal family. Skilled in both underwater and surface combat.

3.description: A SeaWing guard stationed at the Deep Palace gates. Checks all visitors and ensures only authorized dragons enter the royal residence.

7.description: A SeaWing guard who works the overnight security shift, patrolling the palace corridors while the royal family sleeps.

8.description: A trusted SeaWing guard who protects the royal treasury and valuable palace artifacts. Known for his incorruptible nature.

4.description: A SeaWing guard who specializes in protecting the deepest levels of the palace where the most important chambers are located.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen whose private quarters he protects

9.description: A SeaWing guard responsible for protecting the palace armory and weapon stores. Ensures only authorized personnel access weapons.

6.description: A SeaWing guard who escorts royal family members when they travel within the kingdom. Expert at navigation and protection.

7.description: A SeaWing guard who helps train new recruits in palace security protocols and underwater combat techniques.

4.description: A vigilant SeaWing sentry who stands watch at key palace locations. Always alert for potential threats to the royal family.

9.description: A fierce SeaWing guard trained in advanced combat techniques. Called upon when serious threats to the palace arise.

11.description: A quick-responding SeaWing guard who handles emergency situations in the palace. First to respond when threats are detected.

5.description: A fast-swimming SeaWing guard who delivers urgent messages and responds quickly to security alerts throughout the palace.

4.description: A patient SeaWing guard who monitors the main palace corridors, ensuring safe passage for the royal family and authorized visitors.

6.description: A SeaWing guard who oversees palace communications and ensures messages reach their intended recipients safely.

7.description: A secretive SeaWing guard who specializes in covert operations and invisible protection of the royal family.

4.description: A diligent SeaWing servant who cleans and maintains the royal chambers. Works quietly to ensure the palace remains pristine.

5.description: A skilled SeaWing who assists the royal seamstress in creating and maintaining garments for the royal family.

relationships.Anemone: Princess whose clothing she helps make

4.description: A hardworking SeaWing who assists in the palace kitchens, helping prepare meals for the royal family and their guests.

5.description: A creative SeaWing who decorates the palace chambers with shells, pearls, and other ocean treasures.

6.description: A reliable SeaWing servant who carries messages and packages between different areas of the palace.

4.description: A meticulous SeaWing who manages the palace laundry, ensuring all royal garments are perfectly clean and cared for.
A SeaWing who specializes in preparing sea vegetables and plants for royal meals. Expert in underwater cuisine.

5.description: An organized SeaWing who keeps palace supplies and inventory sorted and accessible for all palace staff.
A gentle SeaWing who helps the royal family with bathing and grooming, ensuring they always look their finest.

4.description: A quiet SeaWing servant responsible for maintaining the royal sleeping chambers and ensuring comfortable rest.
A small but energetic SeaWing who handles numerous small tasks around the palace, always willing to help.

5.description: A SeaWing who manages the palace's fresh water supplies and ensures proper water flow throughout the complex.

4.description: A SeaWing responsible for preserving and storing food supplies for the palace. Expert in underwater food storage.

relationships.Pufferfish: Chef she supplies preserved foods to

6.description: A wealthy SeaWing noble who owns extensive underwater territories. Frequently attends court and supports Queen Coral's war efforts.
An experienced SeaWing council member who advises Queen Coral on domestic policy and kingdom management.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen he counsels on internal matters

A trusted SeaWing noble who serves as one of Queen Coral's key advisors on matters of state and diplomacy.

6.description: A well-informed SeaWing noble who keeps track of gossip, rumors, and information flowing through the court.

8.description: A SeaWing noble who oversees the kingdom's natural resources and manages territorial claims within SeaWing waters.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen whose cultural legacy he promotes

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen whose summer residence he maintains

A SeaWing who specializes in moving and working on land, helping maintain the terrestrial parts of the Summer Palace.

A SeaWing who coordinates supply deliveries between the Deep Palace and Summer Palace, ensuring both locations are well-stocked.

10.description: A SeaWing who tends to both underwater and surface plants around the Summer Palace, maintaining beautiful gardens.

relationships.Sea Anemone: Deep Palace gardener she coordinates with

12.description: A stealthy SeaWing who gathers information about enemy troop movements and reports back to the military command.

2.description: A SeaWing warrior who patrols the deepest parts of SeaWing territory, protecting against underwater threats.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen whose deep territories he protects

A fierce SeaWing warrior specialized in underwater combat tactics and deep-sea warfare.

8.description: A SeaWing military officer who coordinates troop movements and battle formations during military campaigns.
A SeaWing officer responsible for supplying military forces with weapons, food, and other necessities during war.

relationships.Squadron: Flight leader who commands him in air battles

relationships.Electric Ray: Palace engineer he learns techniques from

relationships.Ranger: Deep sea patrol who sometimes encounters him

11.description: One of Queen Coral's younger sons and Tsunami's brother. A quiet prince who prefers staying out of the royal spotlight.

13.description: One of Queen Coral's daughters who died young, another victim of the mysterious royal family killings.
A SeaWing prince who was killed as a dragonet, another tragic victim of Princess Orca's magical statue.

11.description: A cousin of the royal family who sometimes visits the palace and participates in royal functions.
Queen Coral's brother who occasionally advises her on family matters and royal protocol.
A relative of the royal family who helps with ceremonial duties and family gatherings.

8.description: A captured SkyWing soldier held as prisoner in the SeaWing kingdom during the ongoing war. Used for information and prisoner exchanges.

relationships.Blister: Allied queen who benefits from his capture

8.description: A captured MudWing soldier taken during a battle. Held in SeaWing custody as a prisoner of war.

18.description: A SkyWing scout captured while spying on SeaWing territories. Provides intelligence about enemy movements.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen who benefits from his information

22.description: A MudWing warrior taken captive during recent battles. Held for potential prisoner exchanges with enemy tribes.

13.description: An IceWing messenger who occasionally brings communications between Queen Glacier and Queen Coral regarding the war.

recaps.1: Tsunami and the other dragonets of destiny arrive at the Kingdom of the Sea, where Tsunami hopes to reunite with her SeaWing family and find allies for their mission to end the war.
recaps.2: Tsunami meets her mother Queen Coral for the first time, experiencing the overwhelming joy and complicated emotions of their reunion after years of separation and believing each other dead.
recaps.3: Tsunami is introduced to her younger sisters Princess Anemone and baby Princess Auklet. She struggles to adapt to royal life and the expectations of being a SeaWing princess.
recaps.4: The dragonets explore the magnificent Deep Palace underwater kingdom while Tsunami learns about SeaWing culture, including their unique light-language called Aquatic that she cannot yet understand.
recaps.5: Tsunami meets Whirlpool, the pompous royal tutor who makes her uncomfortable with his overly flattering manner toward Queen Coral and inappropriate interest in young Princess Anemone.
recaps.6: Queen Coral reveals the tragic history of her family - many of her eggs and young dragonets have been mysteriously murdered over the years, explaining her extreme protectiveness of her remaining children.
recaps.7: Tsunami begins learning Aquatic and starts to understand the complex politics of the SeaWing court, while her fellow dragonets explore the underwater kingdom and meet its inhabitants.
recaps.8: Queen Coral shows Tsunami her private study where she writes scrolls about her daughters. Tsunami learns about her mother's alliance with Blister in the SandWing war of succession.
recaps.9: The dragonets attend a royal feast where they meet more SeaWing nobles and courtiers. Tsunami continues to feel torn between her loyalty to her fellow dragonets and her newfound royal responsibilities.
recaps.10: Tensions rise in the palace as Tsunami struggles with the restrictions of royal life. She wants to continue the quest with her fellow dragonets but feels pressure to stay and fulfill her princess duties.
recaps.11: Tsunami meets more of her extended family including her brother Prince Turtle. She learns more about the mysterious deaths that have plagued the royal family for years.
recaps.12: Riptide reveals more about his feelings for Tsunami and his past with the Talons of Peace. Their growing romance is complicated by the difference in their social status.
recaps.13: The mystery of the royal family murders deepens as another attempt is made on a young prince's life. Tsunami begins to suspect someone in the palace is behind the killings.
recaps.14: Tsunami and her friends investigate the palace, looking for clues about who might be killing the royal family members. The danger feels closer than ever.
recaps.15: Tsunami finally masters enough Aquatic to communicate properly with her mother and sister. This breakthrough helps her feel more connected to her SeaWing heritage while maintaining her bonds with the dragonets.
recaps.16: The shocking revelation that Princess Anemone is an animus dragon explains why she's so carefully guarded and why Whirlpool shows such interest in her magical abilities.
recaps.17: With Anemone's animus powers revealed, the danger to the royal family becomes clearer. Tsunami realizes the murders may be connected to preventing animus dragons from being born or surviving.
recaps.18: Morrowseer arrives to check on the dragonets' progress, creating tension as Tsunami must balance her royal duties with her destiny as a dragonet of prophecy.
recaps.19: Political tensions escalate as Blister's influence in the SeaWing kingdom becomes more apparent. Tsunami realizes her mother's ally may not be the right choice for queen.
recaps.20: The truth about Princess Orca is revealed - the dead princess was an animus who created a statue that kills royal heirs, solving the mystery of the family murders.
recaps.21: With the killer statue destroyed, the royal family is finally safe. Tsunami must decide whether to stay in her underwater kingdom or continue with the dragonets on their quest.
recaps.22: Blister reveals her true nature, showing the dragonets how ruthless and manipulative she really is. Tsunami realizes they cannot support her claim to the SandWing throne.
recaps.23: Tensions reach a breaking point as Blister's schemes are exposed. The dragonets realize they must escape the Deep Palace before they become Blister's pawns or victims.
recaps.24: A dramatic confrontation occurs as the dragonets attempt to leave the SeaWing kingdom. Tsunami must choose between her royal duties and her destiny with her fellow dragonets.
recaps.25: The dragonets prepare to leave the Kingdom of the Sea, with Tsunami having learned valuable lessons about leadership, family, and the complexity of choosing the right side in war.
recaps.26: Tsunami says goodbye to her family, including her mother Queen Coral and sister Anemone. Despite their tearful parting, she knows she must continue with the prophecy mission.
recaps.27: The dragonets leave the SeaWing kingdom with new allies and a clearer understanding of the political complexities they face. Tsunami has grown into her role as both princess and prophesied dragonet.
